Title: Gingerbread Men
Text: Blend all the dry ingredients together in the mixing bowl: the brown sugar, all the spices, the baking soda and the flour.
Beat the egg with a fork and add it to the dry mixture.
Warm the honey slightly and pour it into the mixture.
Knead the mixture until it becomes a soft, smooth dough.
Turn the dough out onto a board and, with the rolling pin, roll it out into a 5mm thick layer.
Using the gingerbread man cookie cutter, cut out the shapes.
Lay the cookies on the non-stick baking tray.
Bake the cookies in a preheated oven at 175Â°C degrees for about 10 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove the gingerbread cookies from the oven and allow them to cool and harden.
For the icing: beat the egg white with a fork until it's light and fluffy.
Add the sifted icing sugar to the beaten egg white, a little at a time, until the icing is stiff enough for piping.
Divide the white icing into 3 small bowls and stir in a few drops of food colouring to each.
Fill the piping bag with the desired coloured icing.
Decorate the gingerbread man using the icing to draw the eyes, mouth, buttons, tie, gloves, shoes, nose and anything else.
